intro: Tulipa karabachensis, commonly known as the Karabakh tulip, is a species native to the Caucasus region. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from pale pink to deep red. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–30 cm, with narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
